sentences.en: By being absent from the trial, he forfeited the right to appeal.
sentences.cn: 因缺席审判，他丧失了上诉权。

sentences.en: Do you think that they would forfeit profit in the name of safety?
sentences.cn: 你认为他们会为了安全而放弃利润吗？

sentences.en: For him to forfeit his favourite hobby would be impossible.
sentences.cn: 要他放弃他所喜爱的业余爱好是不可能的.

sentences.en: Give me your watch as a forfeit.
sentences.cn: 你输了,罚你把手表交给我.

sentences.en: He was ordered to forfeit more than £1.5m in profits.
sentences.cn: 下令没收了他150多万英镑的盈利。

sentences.en: Her health was the forfeit she paid for working too hard.

sentences.en: I'll die rather than forfeit my pledge to her.
sentences.cn: 我宁呆死也不愿背弃我对她的誓言.

sentences.en: If I worked for another car company I would forfeit the money.
sentences.cn: 如果我再到另一家汽车公司工作,那我就得放弃这笔钱.

sentences.en: If you cancel your flight, you will forfeit your deposit.
sentences.cn: 乘客取消航班订位，定金概不退还。

sentences.en: If you fail, your life shall be forfeit.
sentences.cn: 如果你办不到, 你就性命难保.

sentences.en: Passengers who cancel their reservations will forfeit their deposit.
sentences.cn: 旅客取消预订票者,定金不予退还.

sentences.en: She was fined £3,000 and ordered to forfeit her car.
sentences.cn: 她被罚款3000英镑并没收汽车。

sentences.en: That is the forfeit he must pay.
The company’s property may even be forfeit.
sentences.cn: 公司财产甚至可能被没收。

sentences.en: They place their lives in forfeit for what they say. "
sentences.cn: 他们用生命担保他们所说的一切是真实的. ”

sentences.en: You will forfeit your chance of getting your money if you are late.
sentences.cn: 如果你迟到,就将失去取钱的机会.

因受罚而丧失的；被没收的

trans.tran_en: to be legally or officially taken away from you as a punishment

trans.tran_cn: 罚金，没收物，丧失的东西，代价
trans.tran_en: something that is taken away from you or something that you have to pay, because you have broken a rule or made a mistake

trans.tran_cn: （因犯罪、失职、违约等）丧失（权利、名誉、生命等）
trans.tran_en: to lose a right, position, possession etc or have it taken away from you because you have broken a law or rule

trans.tran_cn: （因违反协议、犯规、受罚等）丧失，失去
